intro: Howardia truncata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact, evergreen shrub with a rosette of fleshy, dark green leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom in clusters and are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Howardia truncata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
